result.execSummary:
The defendant Derik J Walter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derik J Walter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derik J Walter was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's extended supervision revoked - sentenced to prison on 9-14-16; unpaid court obligations of $497 and supervision fees of $820
appointing attorney Amanda Riek
Remaining confinement time converted to Extended Supervision
filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz, plea/sentencing held May 21, 2014
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant and Atty Riek.

Defendant Derik J Walter in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence:  3 years prison, consecutive to any other sentence, 18 mo. initial confinement, 18 mo. extended supervision.  $268.00 costs, $250.00 DNA surcharge, must submit DNA sample.  AODA and comply.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration program/Substance Abuse Program.  Commence forthwith.  Dismiss Ct. 2.  Jail credit of 64 days.
Defendant Derik J Walter by video with attorney Amanda K Riek.  Christine M Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant asking for bond modification.  State objects.  Court denied request.
Bail/bond hearing on April 24, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
for Modification of bond filed by Atty Riek

Court found waiver done freely, voluntarily, knowingly.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 02:40 pm.  Hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
